Class ManagerInterface

java.lang.Object
Interface.BaseInterface
Interface.ManagerInterface
public class ManagerInterface extends BaseInterface
ManagerInterface provides the command-line interface functionalities available to HDB Managers. It enables managers to manage projects, registrations, applications, generate reports, and handle enquiries.

  • Field Summary

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    approveOrRejectApplication()
    Enables the manager to approve or reject a specific application based on the applicant's NRIC and application status.
    void
    approveOrRejectWithdrawal()
    Allows the manager to approve or reject an applicant's withdrawal request based on NRIC, if the application is marked as a withdrawal.
    void
    createAProject()
    Gathers user input to create a new housing project, checks for conflicts, and adds the project through the project service if confirmed.
    void
    editOrDeleteProject()
    Allows the manager to edit attributes of or delete an existing project after verifying authorization and project existence.
    void
    filterProjectsManagerCreated()
    Displays the list of housing projects created by the current manager.
    void
    generateReports()
    Generates various reports on approved applicants filtered by flat type, project, age, or marital status.
    void
    manageApplications()
    Displays all pending or approved applications and allows the manager to either approve/reject applications or handle withdrawal requests.
    void
    manageEnquiries()
    Displays enquiries assigned to the manager and provides functionality to reply to specific enquiries if authorized.
    void
    manageProjects()
     
    void
    manageRegistrations()
    Allows the manager to view all registrations and approve or reject individual ones, based on availability and status.
    void
    start()
    Main entry point for the manager interface menu loop.
    void
    toggleVisibility()
    Toggles the visibility (active/inactive) status of a project managed by the current user.

    • manageProjects

    • createAProject

      public void createAProject()
      Gathers user input to create a new housing project, checks for conflicts, and adds the project through the project service if confirmed.

      public void editOrDeleteProject()
      Allows the manager to edit attributes of or delete an existing project after verifying authorization and project existence.

    • toggleVisibility

      public void toggleVisibility()
      Toggles the visibility (active/inactive) status of a project managed by the current user.

    • filterProjectsManagerCreated

      public void filterProjectsManagerCreated()
      Displays the list of housing projects created by the current manager.

    • manageRegistrations

      public void manageRegistrations()
      Allows the manager to view all registrations and approve or reject individual ones, based on availability and status.

    • manageApplications

      public void manageApplications()
      Displays all pending or approved applications and allows the manager to either approve/reject applications or handle withdrawal requests.

    • approveOrRejectApplication

      public void approveOrRejectApplication()
      Enables the manager to approve or reject a specific application based on the applicant's NRIC and application status.

    • approveOrRejectWithdrawal

      public void approveOrRejectWithdrawal()
      Allows the manager to approve or reject an applicant's withdrawal request based on NRIC, if the application is marked as a withdrawal.

    • generateReports

      public void generateReports()
      Generates various reports on approved applicants filtered by flat type, project, age, or marital status.

    • manageEnquiries

      public void manageEnquiries()
      Displays enquiries assigned to the manager and provides functionality to reply to specific enquiries if authorized.

    • start

      public void start()
      Main entry point for the manager interface menu loop. Displays the menu options and routes input to the corresponding functions.
